subject: Technology
title: The Video Game Crash of 1983
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Video Game Crash of 1983.

hook.text: In 1983, the American video game industry collapsed almost overnight. Revenue dropped 97%.

buildup.text: Hundreds of terrible games flooded the market. Consumers couldn't tell good games from garbage.

discovery.text: Atari infamously buried millions of unsold E.T. game cartridges in a New Mexico landfill.

twist.text: Retailers refused to stock video games at all. Many declared gaming a dead fad, like pet rocks.

climax.text: The crash wiped out most American game companies. But in Japan, a playing card company was about to change everything.

punchline.text: Too many bad games nearly killed the industry. Quality would save it.

quiz.question: What caused the 1983 video game crash?
options: Too many low-quality games flooding the market
